definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: leave, forsake, permit (Targum forsake; draw off skin of dead animal; Ar. nat.isa = abstinens ab impuro acc. to Ḳam (Frey));—

leave, let alone Ex 23:11 (E; = let field lie fallow, ‖[[שָׁמַט]]), cf. [[וְנִטּשׁ אֶת־הַשָּׁנׇה]] [[הַשְּׁכִיעִיתּ וּמַשָּׁא כָל־יָ֑ד]] Ne 10:32 (i.e. leave field fallow and debts unclaimed); obj. quails, let them lie, ([[עַל]] loc.) Nu 11:31 (JE), of Amalekites [[נְטֻשִׁים עַל־פְּנֵי פָל־הָאָרֶץ]] 1Sa 30:16 left to themselves over all the land; [[וְדָמָיו עָלָיו יִטּוֹשׁ]] Ho 12:15 and his mortal guilt shall he leave upon him; leave in charge of, entrust to ([[עַל]] pers.): sheep 1Sa 17:20, 1Sa 17:28; baggage v:1Sa 17:22.

usu. forsake, abandon, [[דִּבְרֵי הָאֲחׂנוֹת]] ´[[נ]] 1Sa 10:2 thy father hath abandoned the matter of the asses (ceased to be concerned about them); [[הָרִיב נְטוֹשׁ]] Pr 17:14 abandon contention; oft. subj. ´[[י]] c. acc. pers. Ju Jdg 6:13, Is 2:6, 1Sa 12:22, 1Ki 8:57 (‖[[עָזַב]]) 2Ki 21:14, Je 7:29, Je 12:7 (‖[[עָזַב]]), Je 23:33, Je 23:39, Ps 27:9 (‖[[עָזַב]]), Ps 94:14 (‖ id.); of ´[[י]] leaving Phar. forsaken (on ground, cf.

definitions.title: Niph. 1)
definitions.body: Ez Eze 29:5 (+ [[ה]] loc.), Eze 32:4 (+ [[ב]] loc.); abandoning the sanctuary at Shiloh Ps 78:60; of men forsaking God De 32:15 (poem), Je 15:6; cf. [[אַל־חִטּשׁ תּוֹרַת אִמְֶָּ]] Pr 1:8, Pr 6:20; of men abandoning kg. (under fig. of cedar) Ez Eze 31:12, Eze 31:12.

permit, only [[וְלאׁ נְטַשְׁתַּנִי לְנַשֵּׁק]] ´[[לְבָנַי וגו]] Ge 31:28 (E) and hast not permitted me to kiss my sons, etc.—For [[וַתִּטּשׁ הַמִּלְחָמָה]] 1Sa 4:2 rd. prob. [[וַתֵּט]] (LXX e)/klinen) Dr Klo Bu, or < [[וַתִּקֶשׁ]] ([[קשׁה]]) grew fierce HPS (Löhr prop. [[תִּנׇּטֵשׁ]] cf. Ju Jdg 15:9 etc.). For [[חֶרֶב נְטוּטָה]] Is 21:15 (‖[[קֶשֶׁת דְּרוּכָה]]) rd. perh. [[לְטוּשָׁה]] ´[[ח]].
be forsaken, Am 5:2 she (Isr.) lieth forsaken ([[עַל]] loc.).
be loosened or loose (prop. be let alone, left to hang down) of ship's tackle Is 33:23.
be let go, spread abroad, of warriors, Ju Jdg 15:19, 2Sa 5:18, 2Sa 5:22 (all c. [[ב]] loc., for purpose of plunder); of tendrils of vine Is 16:8 (fig. of Moab).

definitions.title: Pu.
definitions.body: Pf. only [[אַדְמוֹן נֻטָָּשׁ]] Is 32:14 palaces are abandoned, deserted (‖[[הֲמוֹן עִיר עֻזׇּ֑ב]]).
